newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Heaven flies to new high on sale reports.
newsitem.headline: Heaven flies to new high on sale reports.

text.p: Newly-listed confectioner Sweets from Heaven Ltd flew nearly 15 percent to a new high on Monday, carried by reports that CNA Gallo Ltd might buy a 25 percent stake in the company, dealers said.

Heaven Sweets shares sprang 20 cents in early trade to reach a new high of 156 cents, but by early afternoon had settled 8.96 percent higher, or 12 cents, at 148 cents in a volume of 623,900 shares worth 946,542 rand.
Newspaper reports on Monday said CNA was planning to buy 25 percent of Heaven Sweets in a franchise agreement.
"The only reason (for the rise) is the CNA deal. Excitement was early on. There were lots of buy orders but it has levelled out now. Interest should continue on Wednesday," a dealer said.
Tuesday, Heritage Day, is a national public holiday and markets will be closed.
Dealers said the agreement with CNA would give Heaven Sweets access to CNA stores, as well as the nationwide chain of Nu Metro cinemas.
"Heaven Sweets will be able to open shops in well established shopping malls... and CNA is highly rated in the market. The deal would be good for Heaven Sweets," another dealer said.
